definition: cabin/the hold of a ship or airplane

sentences.english: He shouldered past Tyrion and out of the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他与提利昂擦肩而过出了船舱。

sentences.english: The captain was drunk in his cabin.
sentences.chinese: 船长在他的船舱里喝醉了。

sentences.english: We must think, " replied Sado, squatting down in front of him."
sentences.chinese: “我们一定要相信，”回答的船舱，在他面前蹲下。

sentences.english: At last, they brought a captive from deep within the ship.
sentences.chinese: 最后他们从船舱底部带上来一个俘虏。

sentences.english: I went below to the cabin where there were empty bottles on the floor and tobacco smoke filled the air .
sentences.chinese: 我下到船舱里，地上全是空瓶，空气中充满了烟味。

sentences.english: They handed up the luggage from the hold of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 他们从船舱里把行李递上去。

sentences.english: Around midnight, I drift off on a bunk bed inside the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 大约午夜，我渐渐离开，在船舱里的双层床上休息。

sentences.english: Our boat will sink unless we bail (out).
sentences.chinese: 除非我们把船舱里的水舀出去，否则我们的船要下沉。

sentences.english: The captain will pressurize the cabin for the passengers' comfort.
sentences.chinese: 船长将为船舱增压，以保证乘客舒适。

sentences.english: S. Navy said the boat then heard gunshots inside the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 美国海军称，游艇船舱内部随后传来枪声。

sentences.english: All is well inside the cabin. But outside it is a vast expanse of nothingness.
sentences.chinese: 船舱内一切正常，而舱外是一片虚无。

sentences.english: In the upside-down cabin, water spouted through the hatch.
sentences.chinese: 水哗哗地从舱口涌进翻倒的船舱。

sentences.english: The emergency switches for various oil pumps and E. R. fans are arranged at the entrance to the engine room .
sentences.chinese: 各种油泵和船舱风机的应急开关装在机舱的人口处。

sentences.english: There are several different categories of cruise ship cabins.
sentences.chinese: 邮轮的船舱分好几个不同的舱等。

sentences.english: "If you thought of this as the cabin on a boat, you'd say, 'It's pretty spacious,' " Scott said.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把它看成是船舱，你一定会觉得它很大了。

sentences.english: Carriers, Motherships and Titans have had their corporation hangar array doubled in size.
sentences.chinese: 航母，母舰，泰坦公司双倍船舱阵列。

definition: sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
the bow or prow of a ship
sleeping cabin on a boat or train
cabin/the hold of a ship or airplane
